<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/6601b62943a19d4f8818c3638440663d67a17b6a|patch 8.2.2344: using inclusive index for slice is not always desired>
patch 8.2.2344: using inclusive index for slice is not always desired

Problem:    Using inclusive index for slice is not always desired.
Solution:   Add the slice() method, which has an exclusive index. (closes
            #7408)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.2344: using inclusive index for slice is not always desired · vim/vim@6601b62
attachments.title: patch 8.2.2344: using inclusive index for slice is not always desired · vim/vim@6601b62
attachments.text: Problem: Using inclusive index for slice is not always desired. Solution: Add the slice() method, which has an exclusive index. (closes #7408)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/c423ad77ed763c11ba67729bbf63c1cf0915231f|patch 8.2.2343: Vim9: return type of readfile() is any>
patch 8.2.2343: Vim9: return type of readfile() is any

Problem:    Vim9: return type of readfile() is any.
Solution:   Add readblob() so that readfile() can be expected to always
            return a list of strings. (closes #7671)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.2343: Vim9: return type of readfile() is any · vim/vim@c423ad7
attachments.title: patch 8.2.2343: Vim9: return type of readfile() is any · vim/vim@c423ad7
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: return type of readfile() is any. Solution: Add readblob() so that readfile() can be expected to always return a list of strings. (closes #7671)

<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/9145846b6aa411e3ab5c0d145b37808654352877|patch 8.2.2342: "char" functions may return wrong column in Insert mode>
patch 8.2.2342: "char" functions may return wrong column in Insert mode

Problem:    "char" functions return the wront column in Insert mode when the
            cursor is beyond the end of the line.
Solution:   Compute the column correctly. (Yegappan Lakshmanan, closes #7669)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/1bb4de5302ba038b9c59e845b6d735e87d5681d0|patch 8.2.2341: expresison command line completion incomplete after "g:">
patch 8.2.2341: expresison command line completion incomplete after "g:"

Problem:    Expresison command line completion shows variables but not
            functions after "g:". (Gary Johnson)
Solution:   Prefix "g:" when needed to a global function.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.2341: expresison command line completion incomplete after "g:" · vim/vim@1bb4de5
attachments.title: patch 8.2.2341: expresison command line completion incomplete after "g:" · vim/vim@1bb4de5
attachments.text: Problem: Expresison command line completion shows variables but not functions after "g:". (Gary Johnson) Solution: Prefix "g:" when needed to a global function.
